experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experience.description: -Performed extensive literature review for the bacterial glycan-binding proteins and glycans present             in the gut.-Cultured microorganisms in the anaerobic chamber.-Performed the quality control of the Liquid Glycan Array technology using lectin binding assay and          bacterial cell binding assay. -Conducted the experimental investigation of the best DNA extraction method to make the          technology work for bacterial cells.-Prepared and tested protocols for the evaluation of the glycan binding of bacterial cells.-Gained hands-on experience in designing primers, performing next-generation sequencing         preparation.-Performed whole-genome analysis of bacterial genomes for the presence or absence of particular          genes of interest.-Gained expertise in data analysis using MATLAB, and R-language.-Prepared manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals.
experience.description_html: -Performed extensive literature review for the bacterial glycan-binding proteins and glycans present  in the gut.-Cultured microorganisms in the anaerobic chamber.-Performed the quality control of the Liquid Glycan Array technology using lectin binding assay and  bacterial cell binding assay. -Conducted the experimental investigation of the best DNA extraction method to make the  technology work for bacterial cells.-Prepared and tested protocols for the evaluation of the glycan binding of bacterial cells.-Gained hands-on experience in designing primers, performing next-generation sequencing  preparation.-Performed whole-genome analysis of bacterial genomes for the presence or absence of particular  genes of interest.-Gained expertise in data analysis using MATLAB, and R-language.-Prepared manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals.

experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experience.description: Project title: Correlation of plasticity and drug resistance in CML, the implication of stromal microenvironment on hydrodynamic shear.About the project: We aimed to study cell migration to develop a diagnosis of frequent drug-resistance development in chronic myeloid leukemia. •	Determined that drug-sensitive cells could resist the flow, at a fluid flow rate of 554µm/sec, the cell migrated at an average velocity of 42µm/sec.Techniques learned: Handling high-speed camera, microfluidic channel design, mammalian Cell-culture and preparation
experience.description_html: Project title: Correlation of plasticity and drug resistance in CML, the implication of stromal microenvironment on hydrodynamic shear.About the project: We aimed to study cell migration to develop a diagnosis of frequent drug-resistance development in chronic myeloid leukemia. • Determined that drug-sensitive cells could resist the flow, at a fluid flow rate of 554µm/sec, the cell migrated at an average velocity of 42µm/sec.Techniques learned: Handling high-speed camera, microfluidic channel design, mammalian Cell-culture and preparation

experience.title: Research Intern
experience.description: Project - Targeted killing of the commensal E. coli using bacteriophage therapy to improve the metabolic health of the host.-Determined whether bacteriophage can provide a viable approach to reduce the population of E. coli in the gastrointestinal tract to improve metabolic health.-Investigated the stability of T6 lytic phage in the water and characterized the effects of T6 lytic phage treatment on mice in drinking water.-Carried out prophage popping out the study using Mitomycin C and carried out endotoxin removal from the phage solution.-Established that T6 lytic phage can survive transit through the stomach and suppresses E. coli (which is associated with insulin resistance) in the GI tract.-Gained experience in the bacteriophage plaque assay, bacteriophage maintenance, and different plating   techniques.
experience.description_html: Project - Targeted killing of the commensal E. coli using bacteriophage therapy to improve the metabolic health of the host.-Determined whether bacteriophage can provide a viable approach to reduce the population of E. coli in the gastrointestinal tract to improve metabolic health.-Investigated the stability of T6 lytic phage in the water and characterized the effects of T6 lytic phage treatment on mice in drinking water.-Carried out prophage popping out the study using Mitomycin C and carried out endotoxin removal from the phage solution.-Established that T6 lytic phage can survive transit through the stomach and suppresses E. coli (which is associated with insulin resistance) in the GI tract.-Gained experience in the bacteriophage plaque assay, bacteriophage maintenance, and different plating  techniques.

experience.title: Team Member
experience.description: Project – Development of genetically engineered machine for efficient production and export of spider silk.•	Synthesized recombinant spider silk protein (MaSp2) in E. coli and efficient export to the outer membrane followed by a selective cleavage and release of silk protein. •	Developed a novel detection system using FRET dye pairs for monitoring and modelling for the protease based release system.•	Organised project – oriented response surveys, workshops.•	 Prepared media articles for science dissemination, collaborated with other IGEM teams and participated in other public outreach programs.
experience.description_html: Project – Development of genetically engineered machine for efficient production and export of spider silk.• Synthesized recombinant spider silk protein (MaSp2) in E. coli and efficient export to the outer membrane followed by a selective cleavage and release of silk protein. • Developed a novel detection system using FRET dye pairs for monitoring and modelling for the protease based release system.• Organised project – oriented response surveys, workshops.• Prepared media articles for science dissemination, collaborated with other IGEM teams and participated in other public outreach programs.

experience.title: Intern
experience.description: Project – Study of cytokinin regulation in plants and preparation of transcription and translation fusion using BAC recombineering method to study the expression of genes involved in the cytokinin regulation.•	Constructed transcriptional fusion of AHK2 promoter with H2B-YFP reporter using gateway cloning. •	Constructed transcriptional and translational fusion using BAC (Bacterial Artificial Chromosome) recombineering method.•	Did genotyping of T- DNA insertional LOG mutants to study loss of function mutants, overexpression mutants and knockdown mutants.•	Gained experience in Arabidopsis thaliana maintenance, Cloning, PCR, genotyping.
experience.description_html: Project – Study of cytokinin regulation in plants and preparation of transcription and translation fusion using BAC recombineering method to study the expression of genes involved in the cytokinin regulation.• Constructed transcriptional fusion of AHK2 promoter with H2B-YFP reporter using gateway cloning. • Constructed transcriptional and translational fusion using BAC (Bacterial Artificial Chromosome) recombineering method.• Did genotyping of T- DNA insertional LOG mutants to study loss of function mutants, overexpression mutants and knockdown mutants.• Gained experience in Arabidopsis thaliana maintenance, Cloning, PCR, genotyping.
